page.title: 19 A SPECIAL SCHOOL
page.content: Kingstanding Special School caters for handicapped children up to the age of 19. One class consists of severely disabled pupils, who are blind, deaf or brain-damaged, many of whom cannot walk or feed themselves without help. Most pupils travel to school by special bus and live at home, but some live in special homes for the handicapped. The school day begins at 9.10 and ends at 3.10. Favourite subjects include music, physical education and swimming which takes place at the local comprehensive school. Social training includes visits to a local shopping centre and staff and pupils are currently planning a visit to a nature reserve. Several of the children enjoy horse riding. The staff are all specially trained to cope with the problems the children face.
